00021 /**
00022  * @file   ExperimentGeneResults.cpp
00023  * @author Mybrid Spalding
00024  * @date   Tue Mar 18 14:42:35 PDT 2008
00025  * @brief  CallResults wrapper class for all gene translated experiment results to be consumed by various report objects.
00026  */
00027 
00028 #include "translation/ExperimentGeneResults.h"
00029 //
00030 #include "translation/GeneCall.h"
00031 //
00032 
00033 using namespace std;
00034 
00035 /*****************************************************************************/
00036 /**
00037  * ExperimentGeneResults::ExperimentGeneResults
00038  * Synopsis:
00039  *
00040  * Main constructor that will simply contain CallResults in a list
00041  * built by using "appendCallResults".
00042  *
00043  *
00044  * @param geneName        - the gene name
00045  * @param experimentName  - the corresponding experiment
00046  * @param zeroCopyHaplotype - a gene can only ever have one "allele" name for the zero copy number designation, and this is it.
00047  *
00048  */
00049 /*****************************************************************************/
00050 ExperimentGeneResults::ExperimentGeneResults(const std::string & geneName, const std::string & experimentName, const std::string & zeroCopyHaplotype):
00051     m_experimentName(experimentName), m_geneName(geneName), m_geneZeroCopyHaplotype(zeroCopyHaplotype)
00052 {
00053   m_markerCallCount = 0;
00054 
00055 }
00056 // end ExperimentGeneResults::ExperimentGeneResults
00057 /*****************************************************************************/
00058 /*****************************************************************************/
00059 /**
00060  * ExperimentGeneResults::appendCallResults
00061  * Synopsis:
00062  *
00063  * Append the CallResults for a pair of chromatids to the std::vector of
00064  * CallResults. Does some book keeping as well by building indexes
00065  * in place to be used later at report time.
00066  *
00067  *
00068  * @param newCallResults - The results to append.
00069  * @param geneCall      - The variantSet and reference CallSet are needed
00070  *                         for multi-allelic reporting on variant bases.
00071  *
00072  */
00073 /*****************************************************************************/
00074 void ExperimentGeneResults::appendCallResults(const CallResults & newResults,
00075     GeneCall & geneCall)
00076 {
00077 
00078   m_callResults.push_back(newResults);
00079   m_markerCallCount += newResults.m_markerCallCount;
00080 
00081   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::iterator iCEit;
00082   std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string> >::iterator jit;
00083   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::iterator kCEit;
00084 
00085   if (newResults.getCallType() == ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER) {
00086     m_probeSetToMarkerCallResults[ newResults.getMarkerProbeSet()]
00087     = m_callResults.size()  - 1;
00088   }
00089 
00090   for (iCEit = geneCall.getVariantCallSet().m_ceSet.begin();
00091        iCEit != geneCall.getVariantCallSet().m_ceSet.end();
00092        iCEit++) {
00093 
00094     jit = m_probeSetVariants.find(iCEit->first);
00095 
00096     if (jit ==  m_probeSetVariants.end()) {
00097       for (int i = 0; i < iCEit->second.m_bases.size(); i++) {
00098         m_probeSetVariants[iCEit->first].push_back(iCEit->second.m_bases[i]);
00099       }
00100     } else {
00101       for (int i = 0; i < iCEit->second.m_bases.size(); i++) {
00102         std::vector<std::string>::iterator kit;
00103         bool okToAdd = true;
00104 
00105         for (kit = m_probeSetVariants[iCEit->first].begin();
00106              (kit != m_probeSetVariants[iCEit->first].end()) &&
00107              okToAdd;
00108              kit++) {
00109           if (*kit == iCEit->second.m_bases[i]) {
00110             okToAdd = false;
00111           }
00112         }
00113         if (okToAdd) {
00114           m_probeSetVariants[iCEit->first].push_back(iCEit->second.m_bases[i]);
00115         }
00116       }
00117     }
00118   }
00119 
00120   for (kCEit = geneCall.getReferenceCallSet().m_ceSet.begin();
00121        kCEit != geneCall.getReferenceCallSet().m_ceSet.end();
00122        kCEit++) {
00123 
00124     jit = m_probeSetReference.find(kCEit->first);
00125 
00126     if (jit ==  m_probeSetReference.end()) {
00127       for (int i = 0; i < kCEit->second.m_bases.size(); i++) {
00128         m_probeSetReference[kCEit->first].push_back(kCEit->second.m_bases[i]);
00129       }
00130     } else {
00131       for (int i = 0; i < kCEit->second.m_bases.size(); i++) {
00132         std::vector<std::string>::iterator kit;
00133         bool okToAdd = true;
00134 
00135         for (kit = m_probeSetReference[kCEit->first].begin();
00136              (kit != m_probeSetReference[kCEit->first].end()) &&
00137              okToAdd;
00138              kit++) {
00139           if (*kit == kCEit->second.m_bases[i]) {
00140             okToAdd = false;
00141           }
00142         }
00143         if (okToAdd) {
00144           m_probeSetReference[kCEit->first].push_back(kCEit->second.m_bases[i]);
00145         }
00146       }
00147     }
00148   }
00149 
00150 
00151   return;
00152 }
00153 
00154 // end ExperimentGeneResults::appendCallResults
